fr.aria: Cliquez pour avoir le site en fran√ßais

kasa.title: Kasa
details: React router, links, navigation, ID handling/errors, redirects...
hiddenDetails: This project taught me that React has its own language and workflow, which I had to learn.
However, the modular aspect, once you know how to organize yourself, allows for better code management.

quiz.alt: Image of the JavaScript quiz site
quiz.title: Kasa
details: React router, links, navigation, answer and score management...
hiddenDetails: A good exercise in route management with React.
And now, I know that passing a variable through it is not so simple (the score, in this case).

mealFetcher.alt: Image of the Meal Fetcher site
mealFetcher.title: Meal Fetcher
details: API, CRUD, real-time display, light mode/dark mode, responsive design...
hiddenDetails: Understanding and properly handling asynchronous functions can be confusing at first.
Just like error and state management, which requires good debugging methodology.

worldview.title: Worldview
details: API, CRUD, real-time filter management, responsive design, accessibility...
hiddenDetails: In addition to the challenges specific to APIs (as with Meal Fetcher), the sorting system took too much time at first.
Eventually, I had to start the code from scratch to find a better way to declare my functions, in line with my data retrieval.

bubblesPopper.alt: Image of the Bubbles Popper site
bubblesPopper.title: Bubbles Popper
details: DOM management, particle effects, local storage, score management...
hiddenDetails: Generating and managing many particles or various animations quickly slowed the application.
I had to learn to optimize these elements to ensure stable performance.
And of course, learn to structure a game loop that updates state and rendering smoothly.

typeEval.alt: Image of the Type Eval site
typeEval.title: Type Eval
hiddenDetails: Managing dynamic error display directly in the interface required me to take a step back (visual indicators in case of error, smooth cursor tracking).
It forced me to think through all the possible options and eventually find the most optimized one (which was far from what I initially imagined).

passwordMaker.alt: Image of the Password Maker site
passwordMaker.title: Password Maker
hiddenDetails: Managing the user's customizable options, given the number of possibilities, was complex.
From this project, I learned to be more 'modular' in my approach, better dividing my functions for clarity.

booki.title: Booki
details: Integration from a mockup, image optimization, responsive design...
hiddenDetails: The mockup is a great guide, but by its very nature, it is demanding and unforgiving.
Discrepancies in typography, spacing, or image sizes were avoided as much as possible.
And this, while taking into account browser compatibility and some notion of accessibility.

parallaxJungle.alt: Image of the Parallax Jungle site
parallaxJungle.title: Parallax Jungle
details: Image layering, translation, position and transition speed management...
hiddenDetails: Placing the images in the right order (with z-index) to create the desired depth, while ensuring they are well-positioned, was a challenge, especially on the responsive design side.
Each element had to move at a different speed while remaining visually coherent.

profile.title: About me
bio: I've been practicing programming since 2022 and am currently following a web development course with OpenClassrooms.
A solid foundation in HTML/CSS/JS, several React projects and more to come, a few Node.js projects to broaden my horizons...
The goal now is full stack! To be continued...
